inclusion.criterion: Myocardial infarction detected by presence of at least two of the following: chest pain lasting more than 30 minutes, typical electrocardiographic changes, and elevated creatinine kinase-MB fraction.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Consecutive patients 18 years of age or older who presented within 12 hours after the onset of acute myocardial infarction were considered for enrollment.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: more than mild severity of aortic/mitral valvular problem
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: any abnormality of atrial septum (e.g., atrial septal defect or aneurysm)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has multifactorial chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen. Cardiology consult recommended a right heart cath for evaluation of response to sildenafil but the patient refused.
